metadata.title: Momofuku Restaurant Family Tree & Alumni Network
metadata.description: Comprehensive dataset mapping Momofuku corporate structure, alumni ventures, and related businesses for interactive visualization
metadata.confidence_notes: Dates and details sourced from press coverage, Wikipedia, Yelp, Michelin Guide, and official sites. Items marked [NEEDS VERIFICATION] require additional confirmation.

momofuku_group.name: Momofuku
momofuku_group.notes: Named after Momofuku Ando, inventor of instant ramen

momofuku_goods.name: Momofuku Goods
momofuku_goods.notes: Semi-independent division with dedicated CEO as of Feb 2025. Marguerite Mariscal is co-founder and board member.

milk_bar.name: Milk Bar
milk_bar.notes: Started as Momofuku Milk Bar in space next to Ssam Bar. Dropped 'Momofuku' from name by 2012. David Chang remains a business partner. Received $10M from RSE Ventures in 2017. Multiple locations nationwide.

majordomo_media.name: Majordomo Media
properties: Dinner Time Live with David Chang (Netflix)
majordomo_media.notes: Multimedia platform for food and culture content. Shares name with LA restaurant Majordomo.

care_of_chan.name: Care of Chan
care_of_chan.connection: Sue Chan was Momofuku's first brand director
care_of_chan.notes: Started as culinary PR & talent management agency. Pivoted to experiential productions in 2022. Works with culinary, film, fashion, art, and design brands.

fuku.name: Fuku
fuku.notes: Original East Village location closed. Now operates via Neighborhood Kitchens (delivery-only) in NYC, Miami/Fort Lauderdale, and Arlington/DC areas.

restaurants.name: Momofuku Noodle Bar (East Village)
restaurants.notes: The original. Flagship restaurant that launched the empire. Temporarily hosted Fuku in 2015.

restaurants.name: Momofuku Noodle Bar (Uptown)
restaurants.notes: Uptown outpost at The Shops at Columbus Circle [NEEDS VERIFICATION on exact opening date]

restaurants.name: Momofuku Ssam Bar
restaurants.notes: Originally opened on Second Avenue in East Village. Moved to South Street Seaport in 2019. Closed September 30, 2023.

restaurants.name: Momofuku Ko
restaurants.notes: Arguably the most influential fine dining restaurant of its generation. Counter-service tasting menu format. Opening chef de cuisine was Peter Serpico; Sean Gray served as exec chef for nearly 15 years.

restaurants.name: Momofuku Ma Peche
restaurants.notes: Located in Chambers Hotel. Closed due to lease challenges.

restaurants.name: Momofuku Seiobo
restaurants.notes: First Momofuku outside New York. Paul Carmichael became exec chef in 2015, shifting cuisine to Caribbean-influenced. Closed due to pandemic restrictions.

restaurants.name: Momofuku Toronto
restaurants.notes: Multi-level complex including Noodle Bar Toronto, Kojin, and Daishō. Closed after lease expiration in December 2022.

restaurants.name: Momofuku Nishi
restaurants.notes: First Momofuku on the west side of Manhattan. Closed during COVID-19 pandemic.

restaurants.name: Momofuku CCDC
restaurants.notes: Permanently closed during COVID-19 pandemic. Only DC-area Momofuku location.

restaurants.name: Majordomo
restaurants.notes: David Chang's LA flagship. Shares name with Majordomo Media.

restaurants.name: Momofuku Kawi
restaurants.notes: Located at 20 Hudson Yards. Closed during pandemic, did not reopen.

restaurants.name: Moon Palace
restaurants.notes: Casual burger concept. 'Tastys' = griddled patties on King's Hawaiian rolls.

restaurants.notes: [NEEDS VERIFICATION on current status and exact location]

current_ventures.name: Claud

people.name: Joshua Pinsky

people.name: Nikita Malhotra
accolades: Michelin Guide Sommelier of the Year, New York 2022
Star Wine List Grand Prix NYC 2023

current_ventures.name: Smithereens
current_ventures.notes: Named after 1982 Susan Seidelman film. Basement space. First ownership stake for both Malhotra and Tamburo.

people.correction: Your brief listed Nikita Malhotra as opening Penny -- that is INCORRECT. Penny was opened by Chase Sinzer and Joshua Pinsky. Malhotra opened Smithereens with Nick Tamburo.

people.name: Sean Gray
people.momofuku_role: Executive Chef, Momofuku Ko (~15 years, succeeded Peter Serpico)

current_ventures.name: Sergeantsville Inn
current_ventures.notes: 300-year-old stone tavern rebuilt after 2015 fire. Gray moved to Sergeantsville in 2016 and commuted to Ko for 5+ years. Focus on grilled vegetables, fried chicken, expertly cooked proteins. NOTE: It's 'Sergeantsville' not 'Sargentsville' -- common misspelling.

current_ventures.name: Golden Diner
current_ventures.notes: Critical acclaim. Diner format with Korean and Asian influences.

current_ventures.name: Golden HOF
current_ventures.notes: Shares space with NY Kimchi. Newest venture.

people.name: Telly Justice
people.momofuku_connection: Took over original Momofuku Noodle Bar space at First Ave & 10th St
accolades: James Beard Nomination: Best Chef New York 2023

connections.notes: HAGS occupies the original Momofuku Noodle Bar location

current_ventures.name: HAGS
current_ventures.address: First Avenue & 10th Street (original Noodle Bar space)
current_ventures.notes: NOT a direct Momofuku alumni venture -- Telly Justice worked at Le Bernardin and Contra, not Momofuku. The connection is spatial: HAGS took over the original Momofuku Noodle Bar location. This is a PHYSICAL SPACE connection, not an employment one.

people.identity_notes: Telly Justice is a proud trans woman. HAGS is described as 'by queer people, for all people.'

people.name: Theo Ouya
people.background: Born in Nairobi, Kenya. Culinary school in Geneva, Switzerland. Kitchens in Palo Alto before NYC.

current_ventures.name: Bar Contra
current_ventures.cuisine: Cocktail bar (revamped from tasting menu restaurant Contra)
current_ventures.notes: Not an independent restaurant opened by Ouya -- he is bar manager at Bar Contra, which is a revamp of the existing restaurant Contra. Uses advanced cocktail techniques from Dave Arnold / Existing Conditions. Ouya's true passion shifted from cooking to cocktails after working at Existing Conditions.

people.correction: Theo Ouya is bar manager at Bar Contra, not the owner/founder. His role is significant but it's not an 'opened his own spot' story in the same way as others on this list.

corrections_from_brief: Nikita Malhotra did NOT open Penny -- she opened Smithereens with Nick Tamburo. Penny was opened by Chase Sinzer and Joshua Pinsky (the Claud team).
Telly Justice did NOT work at Momofuku -- she worked at Le Bernardin and Contra. HAGS simply occupies the former Momofuku Noodle Bar space. The connection is spatial, not employment.
Theo Ouya is bar manager at Bar Contra, not the owner. Bar Contra is a revamp of the existing restaurant Contra.
The restaurant name is 'Sergeantsville Inn' not 'Sargentsville Inn'.
There is no restaurant called 'Moonburger' -- Moon Palace was David Chang's burger concept in Las Vegas (closed 2022).
Anoop Pillarisetti's title at Momofuku was VP of Technology, not a traditional 'leadership' role in the chef/restaurant sense.
Paddy Spence leads Momofuku Goods specifically, not the restaurant group.
